newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Notionnel weaker, to decline towards 130.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Notionnel weaker, to decline towards 130.

text.p: September notionnel futures traded on MATIF are set for a move lower on Thursday and will head towards the 130.00 region, technical anlaysts said.
"Everything has been overbought on a daily basis for a while and this looks to be the first reasonably significant break lower," said Jim Dodgin, senior technical anlayst at Technical Data in London.
"If we go through 130.30, then we are looking at 130.00 and beyond," he said.
At 0742 GMT September notionnel futures were at 130.46, down 26 basis points on the day.
"We have had so many consecutive up days that we have come too far and may need to correct lower," Dodgin said.
The fact that the contract had traded up against the top of a Bollinger band for the last nine days also made a move lower almost inevitable, he said.
Bollinger bands are lines drawn around price action, acting as support and resistance, based on standard deviations.
Further support was offered by a trendline which currently comes in around 129.64, Dodgin said.
"Through there then we are in trouble," he said.
Technical analysts at Chase in London said the break lower would trigger a correction back to six-week channel support at 129.84, ahead of medium term key support at 129.58/52.
"Any break below here will weaken the near term outlook targeting 129.02 and then critical support at 128.82 and 128.42," they said in a research note.
To the upside, Dodgin saw resistance at 130.70, the high so far this session.
"In the unlikely event of that giving way, there is 130.88 which is the contract high made yesterday," he said.
At the short end, September Pibor was at 96.53, down 0.05.
